channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16692] Make ByteBufferUtils#equals safer and correct
item.description: ByteBufferUtils.equals(HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_BUFFER, 0, 0, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY, 0, 0) will throw java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -1, i think it should return true.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Wondering whether we could abstract this check to a function, so won't repeat the same codes in two places. And it's better to add some UT case covering this case.

And maybe below codes are simpler?:


    if ((l1 == 0) || (l2 == 0)) {

      if ((l1 == 0) && (l2 == 0)) {

        return true;

      } else {

        return false;

      }

    }

-1 overall

Yep, seems no good way... but at a second thought, we could further refine the check to below style:


    if ((l1 == 0) || (l2 == 0)) {

      // both 0 length, return true, or else false

      return l1 == l2;

    }

We already have hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/util/TestByteBufferUtils.java

Fold the new test into the above ?

Looks good overall.
Done.
Done, i am curious why the TestByteBufferUtils is in the package "hbase-server/src/test/" not "hbase-common/src/test/"

-1 overall

mv ./hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/util/TestByteBufferUtils.java ./hbase-common/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/util/TestByteBufferUtils.java

I think TestByteBufferUtils should be moved to hbase-common module.
